alert.note: Alert for Maries; Miller (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 5:20AM CDT until June 04 at 4:25AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Missouri, including the following counties, Maries, Miller and Morgan. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 520 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eldon, Osage Beach, Versailles, Village of Four Seasons, Lake Ozark, Belle, Stover and Laurie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
